alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Decatur; Madison; Ringgold; Taylor; Union (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 25 at 5:50PM CST until November 26 at 3:00AM CST by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...First Measurable Snowfall of the Season For Portions of Southern into Central Iowa... .Snow will continue to move across the area this evening and continue through the night across much of central and southern Iowa. Conditions may become quite slick in some areas, especially this evening as the initial snow is melting is now turning to icy conditions. This has resulted in numerous accidents across central and southern Iowa late this afternoon. Light to moderate snow accumulations are expected in portions of southern into central Iowa through Sunday morning. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM CST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches. * WHERE...Much of South Central Iowa|. * WHEN...Until 3 AM CST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...This will be the first measurable snowfall of the season in these areas. Be prepared for snow covered roads and allow extra time to reach your destination.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest travel conditions, check the Iowa 511 app, www.511ia.org, or dial 511.
